result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:59 AM 22CF28 and 22CM4. Defendant Christopher Scott Powell in court with attorney Steven Daniel Johnson.  Defendant Christopher Scott Powell in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Scott Powell appeared by video means with Attorney.  All appearances are by Zoom. Attny Johnson makes argument for bond modification. State indicates these are not victim rights cases. State objects to any modification. Court questions Attny Johnson and Defendant. Remarks by the Court. The Court will not modify bond.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Bail/Bond - refused
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances and maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.

01:31 PM Defendant Christopher Scott Powell in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Scott Powell appeared by video means. All parties via Zoom. Court calls case 22CF28 and case 22CM4. Def. advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Defendant wishes to have council. ADA gives bail bond argument and recommendation. ADA recommends $1,500 with conditions no illegal use or possession of controlled substances. Defendant gives response. Court gives ruling. Court rules $1,200 cash bond for both cases with conditions no illegal use or possession of controlled substances and absolute sobriety. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. Court is adjourned. Court cancels warrant on 22CM4.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
